title: Basic ComBadge Workflow
description: Learn the fundamental workflow of making requests in ComBadge - from input to approval to execution.

steps.title: Welcome to ComBadge
steps.description: Welcome! This tutorial will guide you through your first ComBadge request. You'll learn how to make a vehicle reservation using natural language.
tips: Take your time - there's no rush
You can pause this tutorial at any time
Click 'Next' when you're ready to continue

steps.title: Interface Overview
steps.description: The ComBadge interface has three main areas: Input Panel (left), AI Analysis Panel (center), and Approval Panel (right). Let's start with the input area.
tips: The input panel is where you type your requests
The analysis panel shows how ComBadge understood your request

steps.title: Make Your First Request
steps.description: Click in the input field and type: 'Reserve vehicle F-123 for tomorrow 2pm to 4pm'
steps.expected_value: Reserve vehicle F-123 for tomorrow 2pm to 4pm
tips: Be specific with vehicle IDs and times
Use clear, natural language
Don't worry about perfect grammar

steps.title: Submit the Request
steps.description: Now click the 'Analyze' button or press Enter to submit your request for analysis.
tips: The 'Analyze' button processes your natural language
You can also press Ctrl+Enter as a shortcut
Analysis usually takes 1-3 seconds

steps.title: Review AI Analysis
steps.description: ComBadge has analyzed your request! Look at the Analysis Panel to see how it understood your request. Check the intent, confidence score, and extracted information.
tips: Green confidence scores (90%+) are very reliable
Yellow scores (70-89%) should be reviewed carefully
Red scores (<70%) likely need clarification

steps.title: Verify Extracted Information
steps.description: In the analysis panel, verify that ComBadge correctly identified: Vehicle ID (F-123), Date (tomorrow), Time (2pm-4pm), and Intent (vehicle reservation).
tips: All extracted information should be correct
If something is wrong, you can edit it in the next step

steps.title: Understanding Approval Options
steps.description: The Approval Panel shows four options: Approve (âœ“), Edit (âœï¸), Regenerate (ðŸ”„), and Reject (âŒ). These let you control what happens with your request.
tips: Approve: Execute the request as analyzed
Edit: Modify any extracted information
Regenerate: Re-analyze your original request
Reject: Cancel and start over

steps.title: Try the Edit Feature
steps.description: Click the 'Edit' button to see how you can modify the extracted information before approval.
tips: Edit mode lets you correct any mistakes
You can change times, dates, vehicles, etc.
Changes are validated before you can proceed

steps.title: Using the Edit Interface
steps.description: The edit interface shows all extracted information in editable fields. Try changing the end time from 4pm to 5pm.
tips: Use the time picker or type directly
Changes are validated in real-time
Invalid values will be highlighted in red

steps.title: Apply Your Changes
steps.description: Click 'Apply Changes' to save your edits and return to the approval interface.
tips: Applied changes update the analysis
You'll see the new information reflected
You can make further edits if needed

steps.title: Final Approval
steps.description: Now that you've reviewed and edited the request, click 'Approve' to execute the vehicle reservation.
tips: This will make the actual API call
You'll see a confirmation message
The request will be logged in your history

steps.title: Request Completed
steps.description: Congratulations! You've successfully completed your first ComBadge request. The vehicle reservation has been processed and you should see a confirmation message.
tips: Success! Your reservation is confirmed
Check the history panel for previous requests
You can now make more complex requests

steps.title: What's Next?
steps.description: You've mastered the basic workflow! Try these next: Practice with different request types, explore voice input, or check out the Best Practices guide.
tips: Try 'Schedule maintenance for vehicle F-456 next Friday'
Explore the Examples button for more patterns
Check out the Best Practices tutorial next
